paper_metadata.title: Clinical Application of Next-Generation Sequencing in Patients With Breast Cancer: Real-World Data
paper_metadata.extraction_summary: Extracted information on BRCA2 variants, including penetrance data and individual records.

individual_records.evidence_sentence: A patient with a BRCA2 p.I1859fs mutation received olaparib at her own expense.
A patient with a BRCA2 c.8633-2A>T mutation tested negative for germline BRCA mutations and received olaparib as part of a clinical trial.
Another patient with a BRCA1 p.K608fs mutation entered the clinical trial and received olaparib.
A patient with a BRCA2 p.R2494 mutation was enrolled in a phase 1 clinical trial of a PARP/TNK inhibitor.
The decision to enroll in the clinical trial was based on the NGS results.
The patient did not undergo germline BRCA testing.
The patient remained in the MP-guided treatment group.
The patient did not undergo germline BRCA testing.

functional_data.summary: BRCA2 mutations are associated with breast cancer susceptibility.

variants.segregation_data: Segregation with disease in families not explicitly mentioned.
variants.additional_notes: The exact nature of the BRCA2 variants was not specified.
key_quotes: Among the 81 patients with advanced breast cancer with targetable genomic alterations, 6 (7.4%) received MP-guided treatment.
Of the 4 patients with BRCA mutations, one with a BRCA2 p.I1859fs mutation received olaparib at her own expense.

extraction_metadata.notes: Extracted data was primarily from the results section and individual patient descriptions.
